EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart is lying on the ground, unconscious. The githyanki artefact she retrieved from her nautiloid pod is beneath her hand.

Text.Value: Perhaps we'll meet again. If you survive, that is.
'We'? You want to stay together?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if SH became a follower aboard the nautiloid.

Text.Value: You sure about that? Neither of us knows what lies ahead.
Well that's honest of you. Don't do it again - I'll give you a pass this time, considering I owe you my life.
You're alive. I'm alive. How is this possible...?

EditorData.SFXTags: Shadowheart gasps as she wakes up

Text.Value: Wait - charging off by yourself sounds like a fine way to get killed.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Raised palm, bidding the player to wait a moment.

Text.Value: Oh is  that what you're doing? And I suppose you were testing my reflexes when you thumped me over the head.

EditorData.NodeContext: Note of suspicion (but she'll ultimately let it slide)

Text.Value: You want to stay together, I take it?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if SH became a follower aboard the nautiloid.

Text.Value: We might have escaped, but we still have these little monsters in our heads.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'We're not out of the woods yet'

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches for Shadowhear and shakes her shoulder (no contact needs to be shown). She wakes suddenly and gets to her feet, putting the artefact away.

Text.Value: You... you knocked me out cold. I ought to return the favour - with interest.
I have to get moving. Perhaps our paths will cross again later.
Leave.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: SH will remain here until the player nears the grove, in which case she's move to her grove recruitment position

Text.Value: No, not while I was out could. I remember a falling sensation - I thought I was dreaming. Next thing I know, I'm here.
Indeed, I'd better get moving then. Farewell.
She must have run off without us... seems like I'm more reliable than your own people.
You might want to reconsider calling her a friend - looks like she ran off without us.
First things first - we need supplies, shelter, and most of all, a healer.

EditorData.stateContext: Shadowheart is lying on her back, unconscious.

Text.Value: What now?
Lead the way.
I remember the ship, I remember falling... then nothing.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart is lying on the ground, unconscious,  face up. The player leans in to pickpocket her. Shadowheart wakes with a start.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This flow occurs if the player attempts to loot her via gameplay/UI
EditorData.SFXTags: Shadowheart gasps as she wakes up

Text.Value: Leave.
No. This is where we part ways.
Wake her.
Now what?
*She almost looks like she's weighing up whether to continue hostilities... but decides against it.*
You're more concerned for her than she is for you, clearly. We need to take care of ourselves.
We need each other, and we both know what's at stake. I can't think of better company.
What happened to my kin? Did you see her?
What happened to our gith friend?
And speaking of - how are we alive...?
You seem overburdened with hangers-on already.
Checking if you were alive.
Wait - after all that, you won't join me?
*She almost looks like she's weighing up whether to continue hostilities... until she notices the surrounds.*
All right, fine. Follow me.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if SH did NOT become a follower aboard the nautiloid.

Text.Value: I'm alive, yes. Thank you for the concern.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little suspicious. Doesn't  quite believe the player, but will let it slide.

Text.Value: I'll join along - if I can speak to whoever's really in charge. Otherwise, I'd best be on my way.
I should look for her - she might be injured, or worse.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if SH did NOT become a follower aboard the nautiloid.

Text.Value: I wanted to see if you'd anything worth taking.
I'd better get moving. Farewell.
I'll mark my camp on your map. You can rest there.
One thing, just before we go. I wanted to thank you again, for freeing me.
I'm sure. Best if you head on your way now.
What happened to my kin? Did you see her?
What happened to our gith friend?
Fine. But don't delay.
No... I don't recognise this place. But anything's an improvement on where we just came from.
Do you have any idea where we are?
You know, I think I'd rather take my chances without you.
Do you have any idea where we are?
Wait. Perhaps we shouldn't. You're not the one I need to talk to, are you? Not really.

EditorData.NodeContext: realisation that she isn't talking to the person in charge.

Text.Value: Doesn't matter - we made it.
It would've been all too easy for you to run right past my pod, but you didn't. I'll remember that.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart's approval of the player increases by 5

Text.Value: 'We'? You want to come with me?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if SH did NOT become a follower aboard the nautiloid.

Text.Value: I was hoping you might know that.
Wait. Where the hells are we? How are we alive?

EditorData.NodeContext: Breaks off angry accusartion of player as she notices the surrounds.

Text.Value: What're you doing...?
The divine tend to keep their interventions close to the chest. Though I suppose it's not impossible.
True. Seems like we're the lucky ones, judging by all the corpses strewn about.
You want to join me, I take it?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if SH did NOT become a follower aboard the nautiloid.

Text.Value: What, you didn't think to search me after you knocked me unconscious? I'll let it slide this time - as I owe you my life.

EditorData.NodeContext: Flash of anger, leavened by the fact the player helped her escape her pod aboard the nautiloid.

Text.Value: One thing, just before we go. I wanted to thank you again, for freeing me... even if you did knock me unconscious afterwards.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grateful - with a hint of droll snark at the end (player knocked her out during tutorial)

Text.Value: We should look for her - she might be injured, or worse.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if SH became a follower aboard the nautiloid.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player reaches to take the artefact, only for Shadowheart to wake with a start. She gets to her feet, putting the artefact away.
EditorData.SFXTags: Shadowheart gasps as she wakes up

Text.Value: All right, fine. Let's stay together.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: This QN if SH became a follower aboard the nautiloid.

Text.Value: Reach for the artefact.
All right, let's get moving.
I can feel it, in your head. You follow someone else's orders. I'll deal with them, not you.
Perhaps it was some dramatically timed divine intervention?

Synopsis: Shadowheart and the player talk after escaping the Nautiloid and  arriving on a beach in the middle of nowhere. The player finds Shadowheart unconscious, and can wake her, attempt to loot her, or just leave her. The player can officially recruit SH, who'll be grateful for the player saving her previously. This dialogue only occurs if the player freed SH during the tutorial - otherwise she'll be found at the chapel door a short distance away.
